abstract: National Transportation Safety Board releases documents showing Washington, DC, subway operator James Curley was denied repeatedly when asking permission to return train to platform after being forced to stop in smoke-filled tunnel; one passenger died and 80 others fell ill due to incident.
lead_paragraph: The operator of a Washington subway train that was forced to stop in a smoke-filled tunnel repeatedly asked for permission to return the train to the platform but was told to stay put.

headline.main: Train Operator’s Testimony Details Fear in Smokey Tunnel
headline.print_headline: Train Operator’s Testimony Details Fear in Smoky Tunnel
